meanings.definition: Firm or strict in manner or attitude
meanings.sent1: The teacher had a sterner look when the students were misbehaving.
meanings.sent2: His sterner approach to discipline helped maintain order in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a sterner meow when it wanted more treats.
meanings.sent4: The storm grew sterner, with howling winds and crashing thunder.
meanings.sent5: Her sterner tone made it clear that she meant business.

meanings.definition: Harsh or severe in appearance or character
meanings.sent1: The old man had a sterner face, weathered by years of hard work.
meanings.sent2: The villain's sterner features struck fear into the hearts of the townspeople.
meanings.sent3: The sterner clouds gathered ominously in the darkening sky.
meanings.sent4: His sterner gaze seemed to pierce through anyone who dared to meet his eyes.
meanings.sent5: The sterner landscape was barren and unforgiving, devoid of any signs of life.

meanings.definition: More severe or harsh in comparison to something else
meanings.sent1: The punishment for breaking curfew was sterner than expected.
meanings.sent2: Her criticism was sterner towards those who arrived late to the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The sterner winter this year caught many by surprise with its bitter cold.
meanings.sent4: His sterner judgment of the situation led to a stricter resolution.
meanings.sent5: The sterner consequences of failing the exam motivated the students to study harder.
